newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil 1997 GDP growth seen at up to 5.0 pct -Ipea.
newsitem.headline: Brazil 1997 GDP growth seen at up to 5.0 pct -Ipea.

text.p: Brazil's Gross Domestic Product is expected to grow 4.0 percent to 5.0 percent in 1997, the Planning Ministry's Applied Economic Research Institute (Ipea) said.
Ipea also said in its January bulletin that GDP growth in 1996 was about 3.0 percent.
It added that the government will continue to reduce its net public sector operational deficit to around 2.5 percent of GDP in 1997.
The deficit dropped to around 4.5 percent of GDP last year from 5.0 percent in 1995, according to government estimates.
The Ipea bulletin said public sector debt also would be reduced this year, resulting in a lowering of interest rates. But it did not provide figures for either.
Industrial production is expected to grow between five percent and six percent in 1997, the bulletin said.
As a result of GDP growth, per capita income in 1997 would rise by 3.5 percent, Ipea said.
((-- Simona de Logu, Rio de Janeiro newsroom 5521 507 4151))
